critique: This document pertains to the withdrawal of public lands in New Mexico from settlement, location, sale, entry, and all forms of appropriation pending a resurvey. It cites specific acts of Congress as its authority. There is no direct indication of ideological tilt, immigration approach, or impact on civil liberties. The order is related to land management and resource allocation. It does not obviously expand executive power, as it is based on existing legislation, but neither does it restrain it. It has a slight impact on federalism, as it is a federal action affecting state lands. There is no direct economic regulation or social inclusion aspect to this document.
